intro: Leucorhaphis lamium, commonly known as the common vervain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces spikes of blue to violet flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Leucorhaphis lamium is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas due to its adaptability and rapid growth.
